contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox kommune | name = Nissedal | native_name = | native_name_lang = | other_name = | official_name = | idnumber = 0830 | image_skyline = | county = Telemark | district = Vest-Telemark | capital = [[Treungen]] | language = [[Nynorsk]] | coatofarms = Nissedal_komm.svg | demonym = Nissedøl | munwebpage = www.nissedal.kommune.no | mayor = Anne-Nora Oma Dahle | mayor_party = [[Centre Party (Norway)|Sp]] | mayor_as_of = 2007 | area_rank = 123 | area_total_km2 = 905 | area_land_km2 = 788 | area_water_percent = 0.28 | population_as_of = 2004 | population_rank = 377 | population_total = 1429 | populationpercent = 0.03 | population_density_km2 = 2 | population_increase = -3.2 | latd = 59 | latm = 4 | lats = 35 | longd = 8 | longm = 31 | longs = 6 | utm_zone = 32V | utm_northing = 6548658 | utm_easting = 0472395 | geo_cat = adm2nd }} '''Nissedal''' is a [[Municipalities of Norway|municipality]] in [[Telemark]] [[Counties of Norway|county]], [[Norway]]. It is part of the [[Districts of Norway|traditional region]] of [[Vest-Telemark]]. The administrative centre of the municipality is the village of [[Treungen]]. The municipality of Nissedal was established on January 1, 1838 (see [[formannskapsdistrikt]]). [[Image:F C Lund morsbonde 01.jpg|thumb|left|165px|A man in a traditional red hat by F. C. Lund.]] == Etymology == The modern form of the name stems from [[Old Norse]] ''Nizidalr''. The first element is the name of the lake ''Nizir'', possibly from [[Asterisk#Historical_linguistics|*]]''Nið-sær'', which is now called [[Nisser]], and the last element is ''dalr'' "valley, dale".<ref>Stemshaug (1973:117).</ref><ref>Cleasby and Vigfusson (1874:95).</ref> == Coat of arms == The [[coat of arms]] was granted on October 30, 1992, and was designed by Halvor Holtskog jr. The arms shows three red ''nisseluer'', traditional red [[wool]]en hats often associated with the [[Tomte|nisse]], which were commonly worn until the late 19th century by farmers and common folk. It is a [[canting arms]], as the name ''Nissedal'' has been "translated" into a [[visual pun]] with the three woolen hats, in spite of the name having nothing to do with the [[folklore|folkloric]] nisse. == Notable natives == * [[Jan Gunnar Solli]] - footballer * [[Monika Nordli]] - singer/songwriter <gallery> Image:Jan Gunnar Solli Nadderud.jpg|Jan Gunnar Solli </gallery> == Notes == {{reflist}} == References == {{refbegin}} * Cleasby, Richard and Vigfusson, Gudbrand (1874). ''Icelandic-English Dictionary''. Oxford: Clarendon Press. * Stemshaug, Ola (1973). ''Norsk stadnamngransking''. Samlaget. ISBN 82-521-0160-7 {{refend}} {{Telemark}} [[Category:Municipalities of Telemark]]
